title: The Anatomy of Longing
tagline: In a world dissecting the soul, a cynic is sent to capture a portraitist who paints only truth—and discovers his own heart is not merely a pump.

chapters.title: Portrait of the Philosopher as a Young Cynic
The Price of a Poet's Heart
The Last Light of the Atelier
The Scale of Four Hundred and Twelve Grams
Not a Pump, but a Compass

story: Write a scene where a character from the Comte's salon (Solange, Armand, Dr. Verrat) visits Élodie's windmill, attempting to persuade or confront her.
Compose a 'lost chapter' detailing the love story of the laundress and the guardsman, from first meeting to fatal news.
Draft a letter from Lucien to the Comte, written midway through the novel, where his cynical philosophy first shows signs of fracture.
Imagine a sequel scene, five years later, where a now-changed Lucien encounters a new, young cynic in the Comte's latest salon.
technical: Create a 'Sorrow Scale' interactive web experience that visually weighs different emotional traumas as physical organs, using the novel's 412-gram heart as a baseline.
Build a 'Light Autopsy' tool that allows users to upload an image and apply a CSS/JS filter that mimics the 'dissecting' Parisian light from Chapter 1, highlighting texture and flaw.

council: Marquis de Sade (transgressive materialism, the body as site of truth)
Madame de Staël (passion as intellectual and moral force, the salon culture)
William Blake (spiritual anatomy, the marriage of heaven and hell in the human form)
Denis Diderot (encyclopedic detail, the tension between sensation and reason)

cover_prompt: A cynical man in a tailored 18th-century French waistcoat, his hand hesitating over his own chest as he gazes with profound, conflicted awe at a luminous, anatomically precise heart that glows with ethereal light, floating just above an open, leather-bound sketchbook filled with impossibly detailed biological and emotional drawings, [the scene set in a cluttered, maximalist artist's atelier littered with classical sculptures, half-dissected specimens in jars of amber liquid, draped velvet, and unfinished portraits that seem to breathe], in the opulent, emotionally charged, and texturally rich style of Jean-Honoré Fragonard meets the anatomical precision of Leonardo da Vinci, with the dramatic chiaroscuro of Caravaggio, [book cover framing, centered and intimate composition, dramatic low-angle view emphasizing the floating heart as a sacred object], [cinematic baroque lighting with a single strong, golden-hour light source cutting through dusty air, casting long, dramatic shadows, color palette of deep burgundy, burnished gold, antique parchment, and stark crimson against muted sepia and black], masterpiece, best quality, ultra detailed, intricate details, professional composition, sharp focus, 8k resolution, flux dev.
